data.title: Kimberly Ward
data.meta_description: Kimberly Ward was born in Ontario, Canada and moved to Carmel, California with her family when she was six years old.
data.text:
FeltonSurf City Estates

Felton is a small town located in the San Lorenzo Valley of California. The town is situated at the base of redwood-covered mountains and is home to the Roaring Camp Railroads, the San Lorenzo River, and the Felton Covered Bridge. Bigfoot enthusiasts will also find themselves at home in Felton, as the town is home to the Bigfoot Discovery Museum. While Felton may be small, it packs a big punch when it comes to scenic beauty and outdoor recreation. Visitors can enjoy hiking, biking, and horseback riding on any of the 80 miles of trails located in nearby state parks. There are also numerous campgrounds and picnic areas for those looking to spend some time in nature. Downtown Felton offers a glimpse into the town’s history with its charming buildings and antique shops. Be sure to visit The Cremer House, the oldest building in downtown Felton dating back to 1874. No matter what your interests are, Felton is sure to have something for you.

Websites:
